snippet: A deal was reached in talks in Ethiopia, with pressure from the United States, on how much South Sudan, which has the oil, will pay Sudan, through which the export pipelines run.
abstract: Sudan and South Sudan reach a deal on oil pipeline fees, a highly divisive issue that nearly drove the two countries to war.

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Khartoum, Sudan.

lead_paragraph: A deal was reached in talks in Ethiopia, with pressure from the United States, on how much South Sudan, which has the oil, will pay Sudan, through which the export pipelines run.

headline.main: Two Sudans Reach Deal on Fees for Oil Pipelines
headline.print_headline: Two Sudans Reach Deal on Fees for Oil Pipelines
